sources.title: Famous Ghost Stories (1961)
sources.description: Famous Ghost Stories is a pilot for an unproduced supernatural anthology series. It features Vincent Price as the host, who introduces a ghost story about a jazz musician haunted by the spirit of his ex-girlfriend. The story is an edited version of the 1960 film "Tormented," directed by Bert I. Gordon. The film combines elements of horror and mystery, typical of the genre during the early 1960s. It showcases supernatural themes, focusing on passion and regret, as the jazz musician grapples with his past. This pilot remains notable for its unique blend of storytelling and the iconic presence of Vincent Price, a legendary figure in horror cinema.

metadata.Plot: TV pilot masterminded by Bert I. Gordon and Herts-Lion International. Vincent Price hosts and plays a poltergeist while introducing the ghost story to follow, which turns out be an edited version of Gordon's "Tormented."
